BrainStim QML Extensions Plug-in

Document version: 1.0

Author(s): Sven Gijsen

Date: July 2015

    Introduction

    A default BrainStim installation installs a custom QML plugin that can be imported and used inside a QML file. This plugin is called BrainStim_QMLExtensions and can be imported from a QML file like:

    import BrainStim_QMLExtensions 1.0;

    This plugin that is stored in the Main Program Directory under the sub-directory Qml/plugins/[architecture] is then automatically loaded and imported to the QML scene.

    Features

    At the moment there are two main script classes made available inside the BrainStim_QMLExtensions QML plugin, these are: 

    1. OgreItem: This class can be used as an QML type. The type implements a dynamic QML 3D viewer for a QML scene. This is made available by the use of Ogre (a popular open-source graphics rendering engine). There's an advanced example that shows its features.
    2. BrainStimInterface: This class can't be used as an item but its member functions can be called directly. This class is the default for all features regarding the BrainStim software. There's also an advanced example that shows this class features.

    Further reading

    To start learning how to create Experiment using the Experiment Manager plugin you should definitely read this Creating Experiments with the Experiment Manager document. After that you should try out some (Advanced) Examples and try to tweak them.
